remarks: A set of real numbers which comes arbitrarily close to some target yet excludes it is infinite.  The work is done in ~ rencldnfilem using infima; this theorem removes the requirement that A be nonempty. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 19-Oct-2014.)
statement:
rencldnfi $p |- ( ( ( A C_ RR /\ B e. RR /\ -. B e. A ) /\ A. x e. RR+ E. y e. A ( abs ` ( y - B ) ) < x ) -> -. A e. Fin ) $.
$d A x y $.
$d B x y $.
